# The Character Function

The character function is one of the most fundamental functions R has to offer and is used to perform key operations on character strings throughout the programming language. 

The character function is found in the base package within the R programming language. 

Character Function should be used throughout your programming whenever you are dealing with character strings and manipulating them. 

Here is an example of how you can use the character function in R:

`characterString <- "Hello World"
 characterString <- chartr( "l","q",characterString)
